posts.name: Michael G
posts.cooked: Is it possible to add custom pages to the WPILibPi web server.  We’d like to be able to configure certain aspects of our vision solution using the web interface.  We’d rather have it all in one place; otherwise, we’d just use network tables.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: You can, but depending on what you want to do, it may be challenging, as it’s written in C++.  You can find the sources on the Pi or here: WPILibPi/deps/tools/configServer at main · wpilibsuite/WPILibPi · GitHub

posts.name: Michael G
posts.cooked:
I’ve been coding in C++ since about 1989.  I’ll cope.

Thanks for the pointer (pun intended).

posts.name: Michael G
posts.cooked: After I build it, do I just replace the one in /usr/local/sbin?  Anything else I need to do to deploy?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Nope, just replacing the one that’s there will do it (and killing the current running one).

posts.name: Michael G
posts.cooked: Where do the nav bar icons (e.g. sliders, cpu, setting, etc) live?  I’d like to add a new one for my page.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
